cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 130 mi (210 km) south of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving north tonight, turning north-northeast Thursday and accelerating northeastward along the Carolina coast and then out over the western Atlantic toward the New England offshore waters
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or over the South Carolina coast (around Charleston area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from north of Chincoteague, VA to Fenwick Island, DE and for portions of lower Chesapeake Bay; Hurricane Watch north of Ponte Vedra Beach, FL to Savannah River, GA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Warning Flagler/Volusia County, FL line to Poquoson, VA; Hurricane Warning north of Savannah River, GA to the NC/VA border including Pamlico & Albemarle Sounds; Tropical Storm Warning Flagler/Volusia County line, FL to Savannah River and NC/VA border to Chincoteague, VA including lower Chesapeake Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Southeast and Mid-Atlantic coastline from Florida through Virginia with extending effects into southern Maryland and the Delmarva peninsula
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤6%) of tropical-storm-force winds; most likely gusts 20–30 mph Friday into early Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Surge of 2–4 ft forecast as far north as Hampton Roads; attenuation up the Chesapeake Bay makes >3 ft at Baltimore unlikely
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of rain associated with Dorian may drop 1–2 inches Friday into Saturday; flooding threat is minor
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip-currents along Maryland beaches; possible minor coastal flooding at high tide
